plugins.name: Sense Injector
plugins.description:
Tutorial

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=swYpvTmmorg


1.Scan a component instance

2.Create a snapshot of its properties

3.Paste snapshot properties into other instances of the same component


Works well with nested components, enabling property injection deep into component structures.


All captured properties are stored as an editable JSON structure.
plugins.tagline: Copy, paste, and transfer properties between component instances

plugins.name: SVGinify
plugins.description:
Convert SVG's in single files or Symbol Sprite.

This plugin will suit you if you use icons in your project as SVG Sprite using <use> tag.

Automatically cleans SVG from unnecessary attributes.


How to use:

You must select Component Variants with your icons.

Component variants must have the following properties:

  1. name - string
  2. stroke - Off / On


Component Variants must have no errors.
plugins.tagline: Convert SVG's in single files or Symbol Sprite

Introduction

This Figma plugin allows designers to quickly insert predefined design frames into their projects with just a click. It simplifies the process of applying consistent styles, layouts, and content, enhancing productivity and design consistency.


Features Introduction

â€¢Insert predefined design frames with a single click.

â€¢Automatically apply layout settings and styles to frames.

â€¢Supports multiple language interfaces (English, Chinese, etc.).

â€¢Real-time error notifications and fallbacks for seamless user experience.


How to Use

1.Open the Figma plugin and choose your desired design frame.

2.Click the insert button to add the frame to your design.

3.Customize the frame as neededâ€”styles and layouts are already applied.

4.Switch languages via the plugin settings if required.


Notes

â€¢Ensure all necessary fonts are installed to avoid fallback issues.

â€¢If errors occur, check the console for detailed messages.

â€¢Language settings can be changed anytime through the plugin interface.

plugins.name: WCAG è‰²å½©å¯¹æ¯”æ£€æŸ¥ WCAG Color Checker
plugins.description:
Introduction

This Figma plugin helps you evaluate the contrast ratio between text and background colors in your design frames, ensuring they meet WCAG accessibility standards. Perfect for designers aiming to improve readability and accessibility.


Function Introduction

â€¢Check text-background contrast ratio within selected frames.

â€¢Evaluate contrast according to WCAG standards (AAA, AA, A, Fail).

â€¢Visualize contrast results and interact with your design directly.

â€¢Automatic identification and highlighting of areas needing improvement.


Usage

1.Select a frame in your Figma file.

2.Run the plugin and click â€œCheck Contrast.â€

3.Review the results, which are sorted by contrast ratio.

4.Click on any result to highlight and improve specific text elements.


Notes

â€¢Ensure text layers are properly named for better result identification.

â€¢The plugin currently supports checking text against solid color backgrounds only.

â€¢For best results, use the plugin on well-structured design frames.

A Figma plugin that converts page sections or frames into individual pages OR moves them to existing pages with an intuitive drag-and-drop interface for reordering and destination mapping.


Features

- ðŸ“‹ Auto-detect frames and sections on the current page

- âœ… Select All/None functionality for quick selection

- ðŸŽ¯ Individual selection with checkboxes

- ðŸ”„ Drag-and-drop reordering to control page creation sequence

- ðŸ“Š Progress tracking during conversion

- ðŸŽ¯ Move to Existing Pages - Map frames to existing pages with destination selection

- ðŸ—‚ï¸ Tabbed Interface - Choose between creating new pages or moving to existing ones

- ðŸš« Smart filtering - Automatically excludes frames/sections starting with `-` or `_`


How to Use


Tab 1: Create New Pages

1. **Open the plugin** in Figma

2. **Navigate** to a page containing frames or sections

3. **Stay on "Create New Pages" tab** (default)

4. **Click "Refresh"** to load available frames

5. **Select frames** you want to convert using checkboxes

6. **Reorder frames** by dragging them up or down in the list

7. **Click "Convert to Pages"** to create individual pages


Tab 2: Move to Existing Pages

1. **Switch to "Move to Existing Pages" tab**

2. **Choose positioning strategy** from the dropdown (defaults to "Left of content"):

- **Left of content**: Places frames to the left of existing content

- **Right of content**: Places frames to the right of existing content

- **Below content**: Places frames below existing content

- **Above content**: Places frames above existing content

- **First available gap**: Finds gaps between existing frames

- **Auto-arrange in grid**: Uses grid-based positioning

3. **Choose destination page** for each frame using the dropdown (frames and pages are loaded automatically)

4. **Click "Move to Selected Pages"** to move frames to their destinations

networkAccess.reasoning: This plugin generates realistic data by fetching from various APIs: Pixabay API (primary image source with 5 categories), static.photos (curated image fallback), DiceBear for cartoon avatars, RandomUser for real people photos with gender selection, Pravatar for profile photos, Multiavatar for unique avatars, RoboHash for robot avatars, DummyJSON for product data, Picsum for final image fallback, images.weserv.nl for image format conversion, comprehensive CORS proxy infrastructure including Cloudflare Workers (autumn-resonance-57ca.rengifo-eder.workers.dev), corsproxy.io, and api.allorigins.win for reliable cross-origin requests, Google Sheets API for syncing data from shared spreadsheets, and Gumroad API for license key validation to unlock unlimited usage.

plugins.name: Image Copy-Paster
plugins.description:
Sync Image and Layer Names with this Plugin


When you're working with images in Figma, it's helpful for the layer name to match the original image file name. This makes it easy to confirm you're using the correct image at a glance. However, Figma's standard "Copy properties" and "Paste properties" commands don't update the target layer's name when you replace an image fill.


This plugin solves that problem. It copies the image fill and the layer name from your source layer. When you paste it onto a target layer, it not only replaces the image fill, but also updates the target layer's name to match the source layer's name.


Cleanup of Layer Names


When you import a single image into Figma, it appends " 1" (a space followed by a 1) to the layer name (e.g., "my-image 1"). This plugin will automatically remove this " 1" when it updates the target layer's name, keeping your layer names cleaner.


Note on Naming Conventions


This plugin updates the target layer's name to match the source layer's name. If your source layer is already named after the original image file, then your target layer will also match that file name.


However, if the source layer's name isn't the original image file name, then neither layer will reflect the original image file name. While the original image file name is accessible in Figma's CSS code and Dev Mode, Figma plugins currently cannot access this information directly. This means the plugin relies on your source layer having the desired name.


Keyboard Shortcuts


To make this more efficient, try adding a custom keyboard shortcut for this pluginâ€™s 2 menu items. Youâ€™ll need to use the System Preferences of your computer. You'll add a shortcut for a specific menu item within the Figma application, allowing you to trigger the plugin with your chosen key combination.


Possible shortcuts:

Command-Option-Control-C for the â€œCopy Image Fill + Nameâ€ command

Command-Option-Control-V for the â€œPaste Image Fill + Nameâ€ command
plugins.tagline: Copy/Paste image fill plus its layer name

plugins.name: TextFlow
plugins.description:
Description:

TextFlow is a powerful Figma plugin that allows designers to tag text elements using {{variables}} and seamlessly replace them with dynamic content. Itâ€™s ideal for creating reusable templates, marketing assets, or localized content - all without manually editing text layers.


TextFlow allows designers to select specific nodes within their file and create variables that incorporate their Figma Text & Color Styles or even add links within content.


Guide:

  1. Tag your text in Figma - Add variables using double curly brackets. For example: {{name}}, {{title}}, or {{link}}
  2. Launch the plugin - Select the frames or groups you want to modify, then open the plugin.
  3. Add Variables- The plugin auto-detects used variables or lets you manually add new ones. Set each variableâ€™s key, value, font style, color style, and link.
  4. Replace Content - Click Replace Variables to update all tagged text instantly.
  5. Restore original text at any time & return to a previously saved state.


Pro Tips:

  1. Modify instances rather then original components or groups - its always a good idea to have a save state to go back to.
  2. Use an AI assistant to help generate variable keys. Try prompting: "I'm using a Figma plugin that replaces variables formatted like {{variable}}. Can you help me generate consistent key names for..."
  3. Click node preview images to jump to them within Figma.
  4. Use sections to specify areas that you would like modified.
  5. Copy the Plugin-Variables frame which this plugin creates to modify or share the variables created within a Figma file.


Created By Adam Borthwick
plugins.tagline: Systematically Replace Text, Fonts, Colors & Links

plugins.name: Move your draw
plugins.description:
Bring your website to life with textured, animated illustrations made in Figma Draw.


This plugin helps you add a personal, hand-crafted feel to your site by turning your brushstroke-based illustrations into animated code on Figma site.


Demo site


How to

  1. Create your illustration in Figma Draw.
  2. Wrap the illustration in a frame.
  3. Open the plugin, select the frame, and preview the animation using different settings.
  4. You can adjust most settings later in the code layer, except for the illustration color, which must be set in Figma before copying the code.
  5. Copy the generated code.
  6. Paste it into the code layer on your Figma Site to display the animated illustration.



Properties

Base color : The color of the illustration before the animation is finished

Delay : Add delay to the animation start, after when the layer is within the view.

Easing : Choose how the animation progresses over time (e.g., linear, ease-in, ease-out).

Mode: Defines how the paths in your illustration animate:

  1. Simultaneous: All paths animate at the same time.
  2. Sequential: Each path animates one after the other, only starting after the previous one finishes.
  3. Stagger: Paths animate in sequence with a slight delay between each.
  4. Stagger Timing (only for Stagger mode): Sets the delay between each pathâ€™s animation start. e.g. A stagger of 0.2 causes each path to start 0.2 seconds after the previous one.

Duration: Sets how long the animation runs

  1. Simultaneous: Total duration of the whole animation.
  2. Sequential/Stagger: Duration of each pathâ€™s animation.



Made by Seungmee

for any inquiry : @smee_leee

plugins.name: Sticky Freedom
plugins.description:
Present your design work in FigJam without worry. Sticky Freedom locks all your design elements while keeping sticky notes editable, so stakeholders can leave feedback without accidentally moving or editing your work.


Perfect for:

  1. Design reviews and critiques
  2. Stakeholder presentations
  3. Client feedback sessions
  4. Cross-team design shares
  5. Async feedback collection


How it works:

  1. Import or create your designs in FigJam
  2. Run Sticky Freedom to lock everything except sticky notes
  3. Share with confidence - stakeholders can only add sticky note feedback
  4. Toggle back to unlock when you need to make updates


One click protection. No more "oops, I moved something" moments. No more duplicate boards for safety. Just your designs, protected, with feedback flowing freely through sticky notes.
plugins.tagline: Collect feedback, while keeping your designs safe.

plugins.description:
Need to lock ALL your sticky notes before a stakeholder presentation?


FigJam Sticky Locker makes it trivial to freeze or free your stickies in one click:


  1. Lock All Stickies: Instantly find and lock every sticky note on your page to prevent accidental moves or edits.
  2. Unlock All Stickies: Release only the notes you previously lockedâ€”nothing else moves.
  3. Auto-select: Highlights affected notes so you can verify changes at a glance.


No setup, no clutterâ€”just install and run from the Plugins menu.

Introduction

Resource Key Exporter enables designers and developers to quickly export all component, style, and variable keys from the current Figma file. This tool streamlines design system documentation, developer handoff, and multi-team collaboration.

â€¢Export the names and keys of all Components, Text Styles, Effect Styles, Grid Styles, Paint Styles, Variables, and Variable Collections in one click.

plugins.name: Cross Icon Svg
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin to export selected vector layers as a set of icons. The plugin can output several formats such as:


individual SVG files

an SVG sprite using <symbol> elements

JSON metadata describing each icon

SF Symbols compatible SVGs

an optional HTML demo showing all icons


In the main â€œExport Iconsâ€ interface, you can choose which formats to produce: individual SVGs, a â€œSymbolâ€ sprite, SF Symbols package, JSON file, and an HTML example (there is also a â€œkotlinâ€ option still in development).


After you select the desired formats, click Generate and the plugin will bundle the files into a ZIP archive that is downloaded automatically, optionally including an example folder.


Additionally, you can adjust the SF Symbols variations and sizes in the â€œSettingsâ€ screen.


The plugin offers a GitHub tab as well, allowing you to push the generated files directly to a repository through a personal token. The form accepts repository details and can automatically open a pull request.


How to use it in Figma

Select the vectors you want in your Figma file.


Open the â€œSymbols Iconsâ€ plugin. In the Icons tab, check the formats you want to export and click Generate.


If needed, tweak SF Symbols options in Settings, choosing weight/scale variations and custom sizes.


To send files directly to GitHub, fill in the info under the GitHub tab and click Commit.


Points of attention

The plugin communicates with the GitHub API. Provide a token with the correct permissions and keep it secure.


Enable only the SF Symbols variations you really need, since extra sizes and weights increase the final output size.


The Kotlin export feature is currently disabled (â€œcoming soonâ€).


This plugin streamlines the creation of icon packages, making it easy to download them in a ZIP file or even send them straight to a GitHub repository.
plugins.tagline: Exports selected vector layers and allows you to generate icona formats, symbol, sf symbol...

Introduction

Liquid Glass is a Figma plugin for designers who want to create realistic glassmorphism UI effects effortlessly. It simulates the layered, frosted, and glowing look commonly seen in modern interfaces.


Function Description

â€¢Adds a liquid glass style frame with background blur, angular stroke, and gradient fills

â€¢Includes configurable opacity and blur settings

â€¢Adds optional layered texture for enhanced realism

â€¢Automatically centers the effect on your current viewport


How to Use

1.Run the plugin from the Figma plugins menu

2.Adjust opacity and blur in the popup panel

3.Click â€œApplyâ€ to generate a liquid glass frame

4.The generated element appears centered in your viewport


Notes

â€¢Works best on light or blurred backgrounds

â€¢You can group the frame with existing UI elements

â€¢Performance may vary with complex canvases

plugins.name: Data Grid Master
plugins.description:
Apply full spreadsheets to any data grid of your choice in Figma within seconds.

Data Grid Master supports CSV uploads or copy-paste from Excel, Google Sheets, or any spreadsheet tool.

Just pick a single cell in your grid, let the plugin find all other cells that match it and select the property to modify if it is a component. Text nodes are set directly.

Choose whether to upload a CSV file or paste your spreadsheet data, hit apply â€” done.


Tested with AG Grid, MUI-X Data Grid, and many others â€” works with any professional data grid setup.

The only requirement: cells must share the same name in Figma.


Full tutorial is available here:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L9baIywE7JE

accepted.name: Evgenii Shmoish
accepted.description: UX designer at day, developer at night

plugins.tagline: Apply spreadsheets to data grids in 3 easy steps. Supports component properties and text nodes.

plugins.name: Layer Query
plugins.description:
A powerful layer selection plugin that lets you find and select layers based on their design properties and custom component properties. Perfect for managing large design files and design systems efficiently.


## Key Features


- Multi-property search with combination filters

- Custom component property support (boolean, text, variant, instance swap)

- Flexible search scope: Entire file, Current page, Root frame, or Selected frames

- Search results with page grouping and navigation

- Real-time search progress with cancellation support

- Cross-page layer selection and navigation


## Supported Properties


**Typography:** Font size, font family, line height, text alignment, text content

**Fill:** Fill color, opacity

**Size:** Width, height

**Padding:** All directions (top, bottom, left, right, vertical, horizontal)

**Auto Layout:** Direction, sizing, alignment, item spacing

**Stroke:** Stroke color, stroke width

**Corner Radius:** All corners and individual corner values

**Layer:** Layer name, structure, type, opacity

**Position:** X and Y coordinates

**Custom:** Component instance properties


## Perfect For


- Design system maintenance and auditing

- Finding layers with specific styling across large files

- Quality assurance and design consistency checks

- Efficient layer organization and cleanup

- Component property management


Save hours of manual searching with precise property-based queries. Transform your Figma workflow from manual hunting to smart selection.


## Beta Version


This plugin is currently in beta. Please report any issues or feedback to help improve the experience.
plugins.tagline: Query and select layers by properties including custom components. Advanced search for efficiency.

Introduction

Clear Slice is a lightweight utility plugin that helps you remove, hide, or show all Slice layers within selected elementsâ€”ideal for cleaning up export slices before delivery.


Function Description

  1. Remove all Slice layers in the selection
  2. Optional: auto-detach instance before processing
  3. Hide or show Slice layers instead of deleting
  4. Simple UI with precise layer control options


How to Use

  1. Select any Frame, Component, or Instance
  2. Open the plugin and toggle "Detach instance" as needed
  3. Click your desired action: Clear / Hide / Show
  4. The plugin processes all nested slices recursively


Notes

  1. Protected components may require manual detaching
  2. Changes are not reversible â€” save your work before use
  3. The plugin processes all child layers in depth
